column4: When I go to facebook.com Firefox tells me it needs to download a plugin but doesnt tell me which one. It fails to find the right plugin, so how do I work out which plugin to manually install? I already have Java, Helix, Shockwave Flash and Silverlight so I'm wondering what else it could be
Have you installed flash?
you're on Hardy?
Yep
I have been installing flashplugin-nonfree for several ubuntu versions and it's worked well in firefox. Mabe try that package and restart firefox
Hardy is the latest release that my computer can run. I have tried Intrepid, Jaunty and Karmic and none of them work: on all of them the graphics are borked.
Ah, ok
I have both flashplugin-nonfree and adobe-flashplugin. Do you think it could be a conflict between the two of them?
Maybe, try uninstalling the Adobe package and see. you can always reinstall it if that isn't the problem
Also, make sure you're running the latest firefox from the repos
And I feel that it would be worth it to you to try and get the graphics running correctly on maybe Jaunty, this channel is the best place to ask questions

That was going to be my next question. I installed swiftfox from  the http://getswiftfox.com/builds/debian unstable non-free repo and for some reason it doesnt want to update. By the way, I spent more than 40 hours trying to get graphics to work correctly on both Jaunty and Karmic before going back to good old Hardy.
It's a good idea to stick with Ubuntu packages, you have installed a debian package and these two distros are different. Never mix distro packages
The only updates you will get are the ones coming from the official ubuntu repos and any PPA's that you have in your sources
maybe there haven't been any updates? Regardless, you are using a debian repo in your sources and that's a bad thing to do on Ubuntu
There have been updates but none have ever been downloaded. I will remove the repo I guess. Trouble is firefox is just so damn slow! I was keen to get it faster any way I could.
May I pm you? I have some things you can do to make ff faster

Oh. I have just tried to download the deb file for the latest version directly from the swiftfox website and the package installer reports a dependency is not satisfiable: libgtk2.0-0. Yes of course you can pm me. Thanks.
that is one of the reasons we don't add debian reops to ubuntu sources :)
OK
that dependency maybe in the ubuntu repos for you but I think the name is different
chromium is supposed to be a very ice and fast web browser, I've never tried it but you might want to. I have ways of speeding up firefox if you're interested
